data.text: @markbrown7 This graph here clearly demonstrates that, before tests were scarce while omicron was picking up, unvaxxed cases were 3-5x higher than vaccinated, per capita. https://t.co/667HNZX0jd

@markbrown7 For those getting this wrong: the data is proportional, so the populations don't matter. It's wrong because tests are scarce and mostly-vaccinated people are the only people who can get tests right now (elderly, healthcare workers): once again, don't believe stats without context

@karinclewis Nice try Karin (appropriate name). Read the y axis of the graph if you can find it. Then try to understand. I know it can be taxing to realize that everything you believed to be true simply isn't.

Same for all the rest of you! Enough with your dumb "there's more vaxxed" argument
@PeterON75954174 @markbrown7 I bet they still won't understand this

@markbrown7 If only you understood the data. Your logic would only make sense if half the population was vaxxed and half were unvaxxed. Only 10-20% of the  population are unvaxxed.. so this data shows that unvaxxed are at higher risk of catching COVID than vaxxed folks. Nice try.

@BRUCETEEL @markbrown7 Can you read? It says per 100,000, so thatâ€™s your argument out the window. Please provide the evidence which supports your claim that 99% of covid deaths have been the unvaccinated, genuinely would love to see it.

@markbrown7 Jesus Christ, you people keep using words like "promise". This isn't like signing a contract. You go with what the science says at the time, and then adjust as you learn. Virology, immunology, science in general isn't always black and white. Hope for the best, plan for the worst.
@markbrown7 Mfs read this post and push up glasses tryna answer with what they think is smart I love it.
